garage.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a building for keeping a car in, usually next to or attached to a house
garage.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: I’ll just go and put the car in the garage.
Their house had a double garage.
garage.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a building in a public place where cars can be parked
garage.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: We parked in an underground garage near the hotel.
garage.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a place where motor vehicles are repaired
garage.translation[0].definitions[3].def: a place where you buy petrol
garage.translation[0].definitions[4].def: a type of popular music played on electronic instruments, with a strong fast beat and singing
garage.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: a collection of the latest dance and garage hits
garage.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: put the car in the garage
Dad's just putting the car in the garage.
get the car out of the garage
Wait here while I get the car out of the garage.
The house had a double garage.
A single garage could boost the price of a house by 8%.
The house benefits from a large detached garage.
The house has huge gardens and an integral garage.
They kept the car in a lock-up garage round the corner.
garage.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to put or keep a vehicle in a garage
